subject: Technology
title: Gene Therapy: Curing the Incurable
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Gene Therapy: Curing the Incurable.

hook.text: Children born with sickle cell disease now have a potential cure. Doctors edit their own blood cells and put them back.

buildup.text: Gene therapy fixes diseases by replacing or repairing faulty genes inside a patient's cells.

discovery.text: In 2023, the first CRISPR gene therapy was approved for sickle cell disease. Patients in constant pain are now symptom-free.

twist.text: The treatment costs over $2 million per patient. Curing genetic diseases is possible but only for those who can afford it.

climax.text: Hundreds of gene therapies are in clinical trials for cancers, blindness, hemophilia, and muscular dystrophy.

punchline.text: We can cure diseases in your DNA. The price tag is the next problem to solve.

quiz.question: How much does the CRISPR-based sickle cell treatment cost?
